paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the A97S variant in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with heart failure, dysphagia, and neurological symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing revealed the A97S transthyretin mutation, and hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with cardiomyopathy (hATTR-CM) was diagnosed.

individual_records.phenotype_details: elder sister diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis, passed away due to sudden cardiac death
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Further history taking revealed that his elder sister had been diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis and had recently passed away due to sudden cardiac death.

functional_data.summary: The A97S variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to cardiac dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as the elder sister was affected.
variants.additional_notes: The A97S variant is noted as under-represented in major studies.
key_quotes: The A97S genotype, although under‐represented in major ATTR‐CM studies, is the most common in Taiwan.

This was demonstrated through multimodality imaging modalities (echocardiography, 99mTc‐PYP scintigraphy, and MRI) and suggest that diseased amyloid cardiomyopathy is potentially reversible after tafamidis treatment.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant A97S was successfully extracted.
